data: Ha Thanh Dong Dr Ha Thanh Dong Asian Institute of Technology Biography Ha Thanh Dong currently works at the Asian Institute of Technology. Dong does research in Aquaculture Pathology, Emerging Infectious Diseases, and Vaccines. He has been working with several vaccines for important pathogens of tilapia and Asian seabass e.g., Streptococus agalactiae, Aeromonas veronii, Vibrio harveyi, tilapia lake virus, scale drop disease virus, etc. Dong is interested in new vaccine technology. He is currently exploring the use of nanobubble technology in enhancing antigen uptake of immersion vaccine. Dong has authored 108 publications in this field. Research interests Infectious Diseases, Fish Vaccines, Fish Immunology Projects you're working on Nanobubble-Vaccines, Maternal and Fry Immunity, Immersion and Oral Vaccines, Monovalent and Polyvalent Vaccines Discipline Bacteriology Immunology – B-cells Immunology – innate Virology Host species Fish Zoonoses Pathogen Bacteria Viruses Stage of vaccine development Antigen discovery and immunogen design Clinical trials Correlates of protection – immunomonitoring Field trials Pre-clinical trials
